website_summaries.verdict: A fairly reliable walkie-talkie with a range that drops substantially in hilly countrysides or in areas with lots of buildings.
pros: GMRS frequency option available for users needing high-power transmission
Good range, even on lower-power Family Radio Service (FRS) frequency
Rechargeable batteries last a decent amount of time
cons: Reports of radios failing after a few months of use
Models do not have group mode feature
Users don’t like the included earpiece
Radios’ range is less than 36 miles

website_summaries.verdict: Great radio and includes all the accessories you need to get up and running.
pros: 50 channels, SOS siren with locator, fantastic weatherproofing, great accessories such as headsets included
cons: The advertised range of up to 36 miles is very optimistic

customer_reviews.title: in my area they work great.. I have gotten as far a 5-6 ...
customer_reviews.text: First off let me say I looked and compared different brands for a couple of months before I bought these.. I live out in the country and needed a way to communicate with the wife and children.. Up on arrival we charged the units for a complete 24-30 hrs. Then tested them in wooded areas, down gravel roads and in hilly terrain. I must admit, in my area they work great.. I have gotten as far a 5-6 miles away down hills and in thick tree cover and still gotten reception. Pretty good reception. Very clear and loud. I will post more with continued use . But for now really impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A.

customer_reviews.title: WAY BETTER than cheap radios and their static at a half mile
customer_reviews.text: Wow, the first time I have EVER (I've tried about 5 models) heard clear voices on a GMRS radio. Seriously, went hiking for a few miles (trail was VERY curvy, but probably 1 mile as the crow flies) around hills and through dense forests at a local state park, and my Mom communicated very clearly, from base camp, with me the entire time. So happy I didn't get the cheapo ones again. Also pleased that this set comes with the battery packs and charger station.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth H.

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight, good range and works inside buildings also.
customer_reviews.text: We use these radios because they are light weight, easy to use, and have great reception even on the 15 acres we have for our church grounds. We have not found an area that they do not reach, even inside the buildings of the church. We use them for Safety Team members along with Midland AVPH3 Headsets to be discrete. Nice they come with a plug in charger and also a car charger adapter. They have had no issues at all. Great radios and headsets. We have ordered about 12 of them now and no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Almost all are now broken and useless. Batteries only last a few months before causing ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased close to 20 of these over the past couple years for my business. Used daily but light duty. Almost all are now broken and useless. Batteries only last a few months before causing problems. Multiple units just stop broadcasting altogether. 3 were crap RIGHT OUT OF THE BOX. Returned to Midland for service, they simply sent them back with no explanation of why they were not fixed UNDER WARRANTY. Do yourself a favor and avoid these at all costs. The only thing they should be used for is a children's toy that you expect to break. Extremely dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Wait a second or two beforeyou speak
customer_reviews.text: They worked ok, as the headline said, wait a second or two after keying up before you speak, otherwise your first word or two are lost in the netherland. The range seemed ok, even between two cars. Line of site does make a difference. A 12 hour day does drain the batteries - and it does take 12 hours to fully charge them. This means if you're traveling hard and don't have 12 hours for a full charge, it does make a difference in the charge.
customer_reviews.author: Gearhead

customer_reviews.title: Radios work great over short distances
customer_reviews.text: I doubt I'll be trying these Radios near their 36-mile upper limit, but so far I'm happy with everything except their high cost ... (a) they work great across a yard, and save a lot of walking/yelling (b) the NOAA Weather Channels work as advertised (VERY important here in Florida!) (c) their dual-Battery Charger works just fine; I don't know how long the batteries last, though. (d) it's great that a 12-volt Car Charger is included, along with the 2 Belt Clips and 2 EarPhones/MicroPhones So long as it's true that we don't need a special GMRS License -- these 2-Way Radios are better than buying a NOAA Weather-specific tuneable Radio
customer_reviews.author: Steve Walter

customer_reviews.title: The quality is great!! It’s awesome they come with the option ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great!! It’s awesome they come with the option for ear pieces, but the “real” range for these on a private channel is about a mile ... at least in my area. Unless I’m doing something wrong. Still good enough for what I typically want them for, but not exactly the 30+ mile that it claims. Maybe if you were in the desert with absolutely no possible interference and the wind blowing the right direction, that might be the range. I live in a suburb (25 mins from the city) and can’t get anything closer than a mile heading out of the city (around 40 mins away.) For local things sure .. I’d recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I use mine for off-roading and it works very well. Has lots of features, compact and handy. I recommend this if you need short range quality communications. Don’t expect to get long distance unless your on water with no hills mountains or buildings that deflect the signal. And even then nowhere close to what they advertise. These are not high-powered professional equipment specifically designed for distance like government, military, or Amateur Radio. These are family hobby or sport communications for use on a modest sized piece of property or at a sporting event, or doing some hunting with some friends in a given area close, but beyond sight.
customer_reviews.author: Denny Jones

customer_reviews.title: Don't waist your money!! Horrible customer service!!
customer_reviews.text: The rechargeable batteries did not last but two recharging. The VOX earpieces stopped working as well. They worked great at first. The VOX works fine on the radio's. I contacted Amazon and they refered me to Midland. I contacted Midland a month ago and have not recieved any response. I would never buy a Midland product again.
customer_reviews.author: Stevy

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life between charges.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, then after a couple of weeks the batteries started to last only six hours, not exceptable. Granted, I bought these used from the amazon store. Not sure if the reason they were returned was because of the battery issue or if that is just the way they are. Battery life should be longer than six hour and that is in standby, not transmitting. Did not buy them to sit in the charger all the time. I will be sending them back if I can, battery life is not exceptable.
customer_reviews.author: JoeDog

customer_reviews.title: Okay radios for kids, better options available for adults
customer_reviews.text: These would be more than fine for kids - they feel solid in the hand and we had them fall on concrete a few times with just the cosmetic damage. Range is not there. You can read multiple comparison reviews and Baofengs usually rate way higher than these. Yeah, I know, HAM experts will probably tell you that Baofengs are over-powered and are not legal on some frequencies, but for what it's worth, I do believe that they provide better range.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Overly complicated, half worked properly
customer_reviews.text: Radios work good.....when they work. First off these are overly complicated. I dowloaded the PDF manual and ended up having to set up the radios in the basic settings. Not using the group channel feature, which was even more complicated to use. So I got the radios to work, but when i used the helemt kit they would not work. They would either recieve or transmit to the group. Not both. I highly doubt its a headset isue. Since they are designed for midland radios, and its just wires. Should of went with actual helmet radios
customer_reviews.author: W. Moore

customer_reviews.title: POS - NEVER AGAIN WITH MIDLAND
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 6 walkie talkies from Midland 4 out of 6 just stopped working with a minimum amount of pampered use. Hey go in the back yard and see if you can hear me - nope for some reason when I turn it on it shows full charge then right to zero. Another when I place it on the charger, the charge indicator light doesn't come on - maybe it's the charger but no it works with this one. Midland DO YOUR OWN QC DON'T DO IT ON YOUR CUSTOMERS.
customer_reviews.author: Chadwick Hanks

customer_reviews.title: good walkie talkies--NOT, see update
customer_reviews.text: A very loud speaker. Excellent range on the High (5W) setting--got 1.5 miles in a suburban setting with no break-up. (I'm sure the distance would have gone farther, but it was time to head home.) Contrary to some other reviews I found them very easy to program. As a matter of fact, if you have no intention of using the privacy settings, they are simple to program and use right away. In this case the programming only involves settings such a high, medium or low power, vibrate on call, call tones etc. UPDATE: UNQUALIFIED PIECES OF JUNK. Both sets, original and replacement, drained battery even when powered off. Unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good radio, don't use the car charger.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use at work. I'm a crane operator so good communication is vital. They work extremely well. No complaints other than the battery died half way through the day. Not to big of deal since they came with a car charger and I could charge them at lunch. Well as soon as I plugged the charger in, maybe within 5 mins. I smelt something looked down and the plug was smoking and melting. That's not safe and has rendered my radios useless for the rest of the day.
customer_reviews.author: mat mccoy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 2 way radios
customer_reviews.text: Awesome 2 way radios. Have had them a few weeks now. They're light and rugged just as described. The option to hear the weather newscast/alert on each radio at the push of a button is nice. Lotta options offered in these radios too with VOX. Rated 4 stars because the range is nowhere near 36 miles. Always depends on "interference". In heavy traffic car to car I got maybe 1/2 to 3/4 of a mile. On the beach with minimal interference I got maybe 2 miles range. The listed 36 mile range is at the most ideal "mountain top to mountain top" line of sight with no interference. All in all great radios for fairly cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: poor engineering design. can clean if bad battery
customer_reviews.text: if you get a bad set of batteries, The poor engineer and design makes it so you can't get out the fourth battery to clean it. normally you could just clean the terminals but since the design has one battery enclosed it can't be pulled out and the terminals cleaned. due to this poor design I won't be buying midland again
customer_reviews.author: VitualBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Good radio
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the radio is good and I appreciate the VOX functionality. I was a little taken back by the range limit. Although they are rated at 36 miles under ideal conditions, I experience a range of approximately 1 to 1.5 miles max. Although the area I live does not have many large obstructions, there is substantial interference which also affects the AM car radio. Later in the year I will have an opportunity to try these out in a more open area and may revise my rating at that time. However, the units work well and are clear considering my range limitations. Bill
customer_reviews.author: William Slofer

customer_reviews.title: Did not make it on our first and only trip.
customer_reviews.text: We bought these radios for a 4 day-3 night trip in Canyonlands. One of the radios did not make it an hour into the trip. It just shut off. Later at night, it showed a full battery, we turned it off for the night to save charge, just for it to die as soon as we turned it back on again in the morning. Tried charging it in the car, though it was still showing a full charge whenever it would turn on, but never lasted more than a few minutes. I tried to return, upon our return, but don’t have the option to return anymore.
customer_reviews.author: luaiani

customer_reviews.title: Perfect communication devices
customer_reviews.text: Our church is streaming services from our parking lot due to the corona virus. We needed a solution for our camera person to communicate with the control room in a quiet and discrete fashion. This answered the need! The clarity of the audio is spot on! The control room is inside and our building is metal. Where we are conducting service is approximately 300 feet from the building and not one issue with the units at all. We will be purchasing another set for use when we have outdoor activities this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer McAlpine

customer_reviews.title: Works on cruise ship
customer_reviews.text: Bought these radios to use on cruise ship (MSC Divina). At most we were talking from the middle of the ship to the far end of the ship (and across decks) and we did not have problems receiving signal. Also tried it once as baby monitor (at home) and it seems to be suitable for this purpose. Cons: Battery indicator does not work: one minute it shows full battery, then just stops working. This is when using provided battery, did not try it with AA batteries. Vibrate feature works, but it takes too many button clicks to turn it on / off
customer_reviews.author: Alexandre Okonechnikov

customer_reviews.title: Research range limits before purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these solely based on the range, I wanted my son and his cousin to be able to use them. What they don’t clearly state is that the full range can only be achieved in rare conditions, completely clear of buildings etc. so the actual range of these is only like 5 miles. So I’m unable to use them as intended - but it’s still a fun gift for my nephew.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Warne

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment .
customer_reviews.text: Bought two sets. Very legible when speaking with fishing partner in separate kayak. At the same time, spouse could converse clearly and hear our conversations clearly. Rechargeable batteries were already fully powered up. Easy access to batteries, nowhere near as difficult as the less expensive Midland products. Waterproof (but I wouldn't keep them under water long). Delivered timely. When Kayaking, put them in resealable bags and was able to still converse and hear clearly; pretty cool. Lot of functionality which I'm still evaluating.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: I tested them and they seemed to work fine. I have not tested them at any great ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything arrived on time and with no issues. I tested them and they seemed to work fine. I have not tested them at any great distance though, so we'll see on that. I actually don't believe they will transmit 36 miles. In fact, I would be surprised if they work past two miles in the woods where I hunt, so for now only four stars, but if they do actually work well next year even close to as advertised, I'll update my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Mike R

customer_reviews.title: Defective Battery Pack
customer_reviews.text: I ordered and received the Midland GXT10000VP4 Two-Way Radio set (Two radios) All components were included in the order, including two rechargeable battery packs and a recharging stand. I bought the radios to use on a cross-country automobile trip involving multiple automobiles instead of using cell phones which are subject to dead zones. Initial charging of both battery packs was successful. However, after two days of use, one of the radios stopped working. Attempts to recharge the faulty battery pack was unsuccessful, so I had to use AA batteries to operate one of the radios. I have attempted to contact Midland to find out how I can receive a replacement battery pack, but I have received no response.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Poole

customer_reviews.title: Nice Radios - Terrible Range
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Clear audio when they're in range of eachother. Nice extra features like the weather radio and 10 different call tones. The option to have the radio vibrate when getting a call is great as well. Cons: Very disappointed with the range. I bought these over the cheaper Midland radios hoping they'd be a little bit better at penetraiting the forest I use them in. Performance was marginally better. They can still only be called line of sight radios, don't expect them to work well if you can't see the person you're trying to talk to. And that's on high power GRMS channels, FRS is not going to be any better than other radios. 36 miles is a pipe dream.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Great for money spent and basic use
customer_reviews.text: 1/2 mile range in “normal” conditions, such as forest, highway, city streets and neighborhoods, maybe in a completely open and flat environment they would do better but we did try and test under what everyone would buy and use them for, unfortunately really trying we got a 1/2 mile.
customer_reviews.author: Malesevic

customer_reviews.title: AS many other pointed out, a lot of us ...
customer_reviews.text: AS many other pointed out, a lot of us got a different model.I received the GXT1000P, not GXT1000VP4. The difference is the group calling feature and in my case, it does not contain the DC car power cable. Did anyone receive the GXT1000P model with the car charger?
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my wedding planning needs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 sets of these to use on our wedding venue. We have 10 acres of property and these radios gives perfect signals from one end to the other. We had the neighbor take them to their house next door and we were able to communicate perfectly. As a wedding planner and coordinator, I am able to use them during each event to communicate back and forth with my clients and my team to ensure the program moves along smoothly. With 10 acres, that cuts down on much running around on the property. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dione A. Nancolas

customer_reviews.title: Good radio, poor range
customer_reviews.text: Although the quality and function of this radio is good, I am quite disappointed with the range. I have tested a few times in heavily wooded areas and can only get about one mile of decent reception. They did perform well in a large building with plenty of obstruction. Overall, great quality and function, but if you need more range than a mile or so in wooded areas you may want to try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Hound Dog

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get to try the radios because the ear pieces don't fit
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to use these radios for docking our boat, so the key thing was the headsets. Neither my husband nor I could figure out how to get them to hang off our ears. And boy did we try. So it made no sense to try to use them in a tense docking situation. Never bothered to test the quality of the radios themselves, but they looked well made. There's a reason the product photos for these radios don't show people with the headsets on: They couldn't get them to hang on their ears.
customer_reviews.author: RarelyReview

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: I used these 1 time just to test them out. They seemed to work perfectly. Then I put them in my closet in my house. I bought these for emergency situations because of the great reviews. Well I just plugged them up to test them since I was cleaning out my closet. And they do not even turn on. I left them plugged overnight because I thought that maybe the battery was just REALLY drained but still nothing. What a complete waste of money! If I were to rely on these for an emergency situation, I would've been in trouble!
customer_reviews.author: fredo c.

customer_reviews.title: Great for road trips
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you change channels a few times. Sometimes they bleed other chatter. But great distance and good for .25 mile distances during road trips. The distance between units does effect performance, but if you are on a trail or tagging along on a road trip; these were ideal. Love the call feature; alerts the other person to pick up the radio for a comm. :)
customer_reviews.author: FT

customer_reviews.title: NOT Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought this radio for windsurfing, since it had waterproof in the description. However, the first time I ever used it, after being underwater for a few minutes, water got inside it, and it died. Reading the description more carefully, now I see they define "Waterproof" as "splash resistant", which I find confusing. I can't comment on whether it works well outside a water setting; I'll be looking for a radio that's actually waterproof (as in submersible).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it once so far so can't rate it on other qualities yet. We got it for our emergency preparedness items. Weekly our church has a time set up for everyone to contact and check in. Works great and we will continue to use it weekly. Will be a great tool and asset if an emergency happens!
customer_reviews.author: Tootie-bell

customer_reviews.title: Range not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is Midland's top of the line model with an advertised range of 36 miles. Overall, the quality of the product is fine but I am very disappointed in the range. We bought this to stay in touch while traveling abroad. My range tests while in the USA are dismal. I measured the distance and all we got was a range of about 1 mile. Beyond that, the radios did not communicate with each other. Yes there were trees and buildings between the radios but I was hoping for at least 5 miles. Radio was set to high per manufacturers recommendations for maximizing range. If range is what you need, you'll probably be disappointed here
customer_reviews.author: John Pickering

customer_reviews.title: My husband love these!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these 2 years ago and he loved them. They have a long range and the battery last a long time. We use these a lot since we are always hunting or hiking we’ve used a lot of different radios over the years and these have been the best with the longest range.
customer_reviews.author: mckenzie cude

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: Misleading.. my radios did not come with the group call / direct call feature as advertised. Even shows those feature on the packaging. Nothing in the booklet regarding them, and looking online I don't have the same menu options. Scanning through the channels is not rapid. It's much slower than my older/cheaper radios. Also, scanning of privacy codes is not available. I'm able to on some other radios to determine which privacy code someone is on. All in all, good radios, but lacking features - some of which are advertised to be in it. Very frusterating.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Platt

customer_reviews.title: Nice Model but limited range
customer_reviews.text: Nice system. Looked at a lot of different makes and models and decided this was best for my application. A bit disappointed at the distance. I checked several other systems out and have decided the "range" listed is a fictitious number based on possibly being in space in a vacuum! None of them give anything near the distances stated. On a clear day at approximately 3 miles apart with no obstacles and clear line of sight, we could communicate with static. So not sure what 36 miles means. I had the same result on two other brands that listed "50 miles".
customer_reviews.author: Jaxon

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: These walkie talkies are awesome. My husband and I were on a long road trip where we’d be losing a lot of cell service, and these came in so handy! We were always able to hear each other, even when a few miles apart, and it was easier and faster than trying to call each other. We also tested these about 20 miles apart, and they worked! Awesome product. The only thing is the battery indicator goes from showing “Full” to “Low” without letting you know that it’s even at half life, but they did last most of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Zamora

customer_reviews.title: Don’t risk your life on them!
customer_reviews.text: These are not what they’re cracked up to be! I spent the $70. Got my GRMS license . Live by the Gulf of Mexico , don’t believe the hype about 35 mile range . Glorified kids walkie talkie. Wouldn’t buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Proman

customer_reviews.title: DO  NOT WORK
customer_reviews.text: Do not work. Bought to use on a 3 week cruise in July. I should have tested them before leaving home. We are near the end of our first week and every time we try to use them, they do not work. Will work in the same room, but that is all :(, Will be dead weight in our luggage going home, going to try to get them back home to return worst pair of walkie talkies ever tried to use.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy H. Norton

customer_reviews.title: My battery came practically dead
customer_reviews.text: Please I bought a pair of GXT1000VP4 through Amazon in the beggining of october. After a days using I realized that one battery simply doesn't hold charge. It goes from full battery to turning off after a 3 hour-period. The problem seems to be that if I leave the radio turned on it doesn't last. It goes from 100% battery to turned off. I had followed the initial charge instructions as advertised on the radio's manual. Would there be any way of solving this problem? I'm really excited about the radios but one of them doesn't hold charge for more than 3 hours and that's keeping from using the product as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: pedroturbay

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these a couple of years ago because we do a lot of mountain traveling. From the city through the Rocky Mountains and to the furthest west side of the state we were able to communicate clearly almost the entire way. The only time we lost signal was about 50 yards into the Eisenhower Tunnel. At times we've been well over a mile apart from each other or out of sight and still work great. I will be purchasing another set of these. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Irish Beauty

customer_reviews.title: Used for a two car road trip
customer_reviews.text: We moved cross country, two cars, two adults and 4 animals. These walkie talkies were a life saver! Communication and use was so easy! Now my kids use them for multiple car camping trips. HIGHLY recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Booker D

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these 2 years ago for our farming operation. We use them only in the spring and fall, yet charge them periodically while not in season use to keep them going. This year, the third year of minimal usage, they barely work and barely stay charged. Even the second year of usage they would not stay charged. The distance range has dropped dramatically every year. The best distance these ever worked was a couple of miles at very best. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kc2Kctoo

customer_reviews.title: Workable but not great.
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok I guess. The scan function is totally broken. The radio stops on channels with no traffic and never resumes. No repeater functionality. Really not much better than toy radios. Come on midland. Give us a professional product. Range is alright.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: No issue with Amazon but--I intenionally paid more for these thinking I would get more range. The 36 mile range is about 1.5 with static! The manual suggested line of sight but who lives on a mountain top and always talks to someone on another mountain top. Only part of the channels are actually usable as the FCC has control of 15 of them and it cost close to $100 dollars to get a liscense. Another 11 channels are set to low power, per FCC regs. and who knows those ranges, 1000 ft.All in all I would say I wasted $40.00 on better radios and got nothing better! The info on these radios needs to be more complete and honest.
customer_reviews.author: Hoppy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for your tool box of life
customer_reviews.text: we used these on many road trips and the are great the battery life is good they will not reach the 36 mile range like the claim at best we could get 3 miles but that's still great range for a walkie talkies. I only wish they picked up CB transmissions but that is neither here or there. If you need these Get them and if you dont need them get them you will have a use for them that you never knew you did. we have used them when the kids are out side playing, fishing trips, road trips, and many more places.
customer_reviews.author: Nevel

customer_reviews.title: They work, just not completely for what I needed them for
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for a car cruise, and they didn't completely hold up. the signal was often dropped and I didn't even try more than 10 mile range. The range on these (like most of the products that use wireless comms) isn't as advertised unless under the perfect conditions. I give this item a 3 star only because it is useful and durable for close quarters things like camping trips, hiking with groups, or any outdoor activity where you are still near your friends.
customer_reviews.author: iJKJames

customer_reviews.title: Clear crisp sound, great range and battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I ride atv with a friend and we use these to communicate when we are on the trails. These work really well. Very clear, good range, great battery life, zero complaints. I had an older set with some more expensive throat mics, but there was to much muffled sound and the communication was not great. These are much better radios and the more basic mic is working much better as well.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn M

customer_reviews.title: Great radios
customer_reviews.text: The claimed 36 mile distance is a bit exaggerated, as that is a hypothetical scenario of being on open flat ground/water or mountain top to mountain top. Realistically, I am getting about 1 to 1.5 miles in a wooded, slightly hilly area. Pleanty for what I am using it for. The sound quality is great too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H

customer_reviews.title: No where near 36 mile distance
customer_reviews.text: These are good radios. But if you buy it with the expectation you're going to get anywhere near the 36 mile range. Don't do it. To get that range you'd better be on the Bonneville Salt Flats, with no obstructions and a clean line of site to the recipient. In town, you may get 1/2 mile. In the mountains, you may get 3/4 mile range. When you're in a reasonable range, transmission is easy, and reception quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: BowHunter60

customer_reviews.title: Radios work great, took on Road trip from Georgia To California ...
customer_reviews.text: Radios work great, took on Road trip from Georgia To California on my way home after ETS out Active duty. Put them away, yr later needed them for camping trip up to Burney Falls CA, one radio worked the other would turn on but could barely see the screen and no function at all. Both got fully charged before the trip. Only got two stars because they work awesome when it worked however if you plan on having these two ways around for the long haul think twice.
customer_reviews.author: Tnansel23

customer_reviews.title: Work as they should.
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is good, sound quality is good but I haven't really tried to see what sort of distance they get. We use them as intercoms when we ride our motorcycles so we are never that far apart. But they do feel like quality radios and haven't had any problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Levanti

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Special note about the car charger...
customer_reviews.text: Product worked well, though even in a flat portion of Texas on I-40 I had much less than 30-mile range. The main complaint I have is about the car charger. The car charger plugs into the base, not the handset. So you’ll need to have a spot for the base in your car if you intend to use the car charger. You can buy a separate car charger that plugs into the headset directly, which I did for the second vehicle but I wish I had bought two. I didn’t realize the car charger was for the base until it was too late. Otherwise, a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Kent C.

customer_reviews.title: Not even water resistant!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with my product. Used 2x in the neighborhood with my kids and once at the beach. One got splashed with water and died almost immediately. Midland products were the best back in the day, it sounds like quality has really dropped off.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Grishman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fartin around or camping
customer_reviews.text: Considering these are the adult version of the walkie talkies I had as a kid, these are perfect for camping or scouting. Just one more thing added to my bug out bag. If you’re planning on using these as your only form of coms then I’d highly suggest you look into a ham radio because these are just for quick communication. Not sure why everyone is having a hard time understanding that.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up when my wife and I drove separate cars across the country instead of using cell. Now we use them on the property. Good radio and well worth the money. Never had a range issue but we never got seperated too far either. My only complaint is the battery level indicator is inaccurate; no matter how charged the batteries are it always shows full. We get more than eight hours of always-on use from a full charge. Ear piece is kinda cheesy but that's subjective.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This product isn't worth spending your money
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about these walkie talkies. I recieved them. Read the instructions. Used the batteries till they died, then let them charge and they didn't even last 4 hours. I wad really disappointed. I contacted Amazon. They supposedly gave me a cheap credit that I still haven't seen. Never did hear anything from Kirkland. Just irritated that I spend 14.95 a month on Amazon prime for what??? Crappy product and reports that don't follow through
customer_reviews.author: Corinne Cody

customer_reviews.title: Decent, no complaints.
customer_reviews.text: In typical suburban environment (two story houses), I get about a mile range (as the crow flies). Maybe two-ish. This is on "hi" setting. All features work as described in manual, no surprises.
customer_reviews.author: S B

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Good price but hard to use. Buttons hard and tiring to hold down. Instructions are cryptic and in tiny print. Has features I never figured out, and it turns on beeps I do not want or need with no clear way to stop it.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great. For the price they are awesome
customer_reviews.text: Great. For the price they are awesome. We used them on our trip out west to caravan and communicate between cars and while hiking. They did the trick. Know that they come with a single base unit to charge them so you can't have them charging in separate cars.
customer_reviews.author: ObiWan

customer_reviews.title: Family fun
customer_reviews.text: the family loves these. These test them on a walk and they definitely are far reaching enough to keep who ever stays back in touch. The sound quality is amazing. I am not sure about water proof as we haven't tried them in rain.
customer_reviews.author: Bree

customer_reviews.title: clear with great signal
customer_reviews.text: We got these because I had hip surgery from being injured in iraq. He is a mechanic working out of the home so he can care for me and we needed a way for me to get ahold of him quickly if I needed him. These worked perfectly! He had to run to the store a few days after my surgery and we tried it out to see how far it would reach. He made it to the store approximately 3 to 4 miles down the road and I could still hear him. They definitely worked for what we needed them for and im sure we will be using them for other things in the future. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Bought for roadtrip
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our move out of state so we could communicate with the moving truck and our car when there wasn't reliable cell service. These work great. It was crystal clear and easy to understand the other line. I will say, going past construction zones and driving past truckers we got a lot of interference even after switching the channels - that is inevitable when you are around other signals. They work great and have a long battery life.
customer_reviews.author: K. M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Walkie Talkies!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Walkie talkies, they only get up to about 5 miles, so if you expecting more, these are the ones, they are very clear, very handy and easy to use. I gave them 5 star because of th quality, signal, and clarity when you talk in them. If your using them for camping, hiking, anything outdoors, you will be pleased, if your wanting longer distance I'm not sure you will like these.
customer_reviews.author: WearJesusWell

customer_reviews.title: The perfect car to car walkie-talkie
customer_reviews.text: The perfect car to car walkie-talkie - We purchased and used these for a cross-country trip just recently. They worked amazingly well. The battery life was outstanding. The sound quality was great. No difficulty transmitting. I would recommend this model to anyone wanting to use them for car to car communication while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: DocOnline

customer_reviews.title: 5+ miles in a major metropolitan area
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for an upcoming beach fishing trip to communicate back to camp. Prior to the trip my buddy and I tested them out for range. Much to my surprise we were still able to communicate once he returned home (5 miles as the crow flies, in a major city with power lines trees and residential and commercial buildings in between). These will easily be sufficient on the beach with little to no interference.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D.

customer_reviews.title: Radio
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Only downfall, I should have paid attn to label if it’s waterproof vs water resistant. Husband flipped his kayak and within 5 minutes the radio filled with water and NO LONGER works. Warning: PAY ATTN TO DETAILS...I failed in this area and paid the price! Look for WATERPROOF, SUBMERSIBLE and Floats!
customer_reviews.author: P&P B.

customer_reviews.title: No USB charging port, must use single charge stand for both
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was made after using some on job. I hadn't noticed, however, that these do not have a micro USB charging port. You have to return the two of them to their charging stand after about 6-8 of use. Nice accessories but I would have given them 4 stars if they had been clear about that in the description, five stars if they'd had a USB style charging port.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works ok in the mountains
customer_reviews.text: We use these on family ski trips. A little bulky for kids to carry, but easy to use and less expensive than a cell phone per kid. Has saved us many times when someone wanders off the wrong trail. Beware in mountains, the range can be very short, as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mostafitty

customer_reviews.title: Happy with Midland radios
customer_reviews.text: They seem to work well for my purposes. I wish there was a DC lighter plug to CHG port charging cable. The only way to charge off a lighter socket is to use the base charger. This doesn’t work well in a moving vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Thisius

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good radio
customer_reviews.text: We've tried a lot of brand and kinds of radios out here in the TN mountains. These work better than most. Sometimes there's a lot of fog and they have to go through a lot of cedar and other trees. I'm only talking to someone about 500 ft away but we can hear most of the time
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Stull

customer_reviews.title: Decent affordable option for motorcycle communication
customer_reviews.text: We use this set to communicate with each other while on two different motorcycles. It's more affordable than sets that are specifically designed for motorcycling, but it works well. Battery life is decent (we have yet to run out of battery power whilst on day trips) and VOX (voice operated use) works reasonably well. Sometimes -at highway speeds- the wind causes one of the "lines" to remain open so that the other person can't really talk back. People have been complaining about the range of these things, but for our purposes (never being over 3 city blocks away from each other) it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Celia

customer_reviews.title: Not long range
customer_reviews.text: I bought these thinking I would get superior range. They ended up having typical range of less than 1 mile in city. The menu wasn't user friendly. The ear pieces don't fit on ear right but if you are looking for Walky talkies for close range communication, these are great. I like rechargeable features including recharfing deck.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: These radios are great, we use them everywhere. Range is ok, we have been separated by miles and it works in the woods. Real life is about 1.5 to 2 miles in the city or woods. I cannot see these getting the range they state they will get but it has been good enough for me. I did use these in the Grand Canyon and it may have gone 10 miles but barely.
customer_reviews.author: jbyrd

customer_reviews.title: Good for camping and outside use
customer_reviews.text: Cons: Not what looks like on the picture. These are bigger than Motorola and it's material and finished are not the same quality. It's sounds it not so clear as Motorola. Pros: Good quantity of channels High power Easy to use and charge.
customer_reviews.author: John Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Quite amazed and happy by the features and overall quality so ...
customer_reviews.text: Quite amazed and happy by the features and overall quality so far.. have not taken on a trip yet. I like using my Eneloop batteries, but the recessed slot is a very tight fit for the eneloops, and on the verge of getting permanently stuck in there with temperature change. It might be okay for alkalines, but i havent tried.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my sailboat because I dont have an on board radio and I'd like to at least be able to contact someone if I have issues. It says waterproof but these are NOT WATERPROOF. They are SPLASHPROOF. These worked fairly well until one was dropped in the lake. It went under but was retrieved quickly (and the listing says waterproof) so I thought it would be okay however it quickly stopped working. Calling these waterproof is extremely misleading and I'm really disappointed I wasted my money on these.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Excellant Walkie Talkies
customer_reviews.text: Sounds as good as a good radio broadcast, very clear. Turned roger beep off. Makes a static sound before squelch kicks in after you stop transmitting, so that function is useless unless you get off on the beeping. In the directions it explains what range you can expect according to your location. High frequencies will bounce off of buildings, trees, thick heads, etc. So unless you and your buddy stand on the highest skyscraper, within 35 miles of each other and a helicopter or airliner doesn't fly between you, than you won't get the 35 mile range. All else fails read the manual, not rocket science.
customer_reviews.author: DYTRIPPER

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I tried out my new radios. Was down my hallway about 30 apart it seemed to work fine. Drive one block away and could not get a connection with the other person. So the video is misleading. They do not work for carp. My sins toy walkitalkys work better then these. Thought if I put more money into it it will be awesome. No the $15 toy ones work way better. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not all there as advertized!
customer_reviews.text: Did not meet all distance offers on a clear flat open lake, Lost signal after about 5 miles. Lake is 10 miles long and 2 miles wide, longest straight distance is 7 miles and lost signal before reaching other point. Product offers 20-36 mile range. Head phones do not provide good clear voice Tx/Rx. Thinking about returning them by end of this week and look for better options if personnel is not satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really limited after 400 yards
customer_reviews.text: Distance was definitely limited I tried buy the longest distance one I could find because the 2 football fields length I needed to talk to Really limited after 400 yards
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: self-help is good enough. I'll continue to buy these
customer_reviews.text: These aren't commercial-grade radios. Any comparison to professional units is misleading. Don't believe the 36-mile range. For everyday use -- even under rough conditions -- these do the job at the no-kill animal shelter where I volunteer. They're scraped against concrete walls, dropped, and get wet in the rain. Of the 20 or so units we own, only two have been returned for warranty replacement. Sometimes, the radios just stop working. Pulling out the battery and reinserting it almost always resolves the issue. Yeah, this is bit of a hassle, but for $25 a radio, self-help is good enough. I'll continue to buy these.
customer_reviews.author: T. Colgan

customer_reviews.title: Nice set for the first 2 months
customer_reviews.text: This radio set is alright, I guess. The range listed in the description is definitely overestimated and one of the batteries stopped holding a charge after only 2 months of use (the 2nd radio battery is still holding a charge after 10 months). Not the best quality, but I am not going to complain too much for the price. Nice features, but be sure to keep the instructions with you to be able to access them all. Some of the directions to get the radio to do certain things are pretty complex. Over all...the battery should have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Waited 3 weeks for my item i get it and ...
customer_reviews.text: Waited 3 weeks for my item i get it and the shipping box was ok but the midland box was ripped and it was missing a battery pack. Im trying to get a replacement now gota wait longer longer to use them
customer_reviews.author: Dustin S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent radios Good headsets
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with these radios. Good range, easy to use, great sound quality, and the cheap headsets that come with it work really good. We bought them to wear while bicycling and wind noise is not an issue at all. Sound quality with the headset is good, they are comfortable for wearing an hour or two (at least). Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: General Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Work great.
customer_reviews.text: ordered these so that I can communicate with the pit crew not knowing what to expect for this price. Work great. Very clear and good range. Earbud and mic fits easily under helmet. Talk button a little awkward but I don't talk under green anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Cox

customer_reviews.title: Buy brand new!
customer_reviews.text: I bought for of these radios. Two used and two brand new trying to save some money. From what I have seen and we put them through the ringer. These radios are great. Even the battery life is great. The range is great and they are super easy to use. This is a new frill no gimmick radio. It has a descent range with easy set up and durable construction. I have seen one get run over with 40k pound piece of construction equipment and still work for three days. Just do yourself a favor and buy the brand new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Kieffer Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for Known Product
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased and have been extremely impressed with the capability of the radios. The only down side is that they did not come with the "Y" charging cable as included in the ad. We use it as a home monitor and for communications on the road. Product has been around for years and is proven. Great price through seller.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: Works great around a camp ground. Hills and trees can break up the signal but works well and easy to use. Would buy again for sure. Can stay connected up to a mile through the woods but you need line of sight the further away you get. Looking to add a base station with more power for better range.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Power I was Look For
customer_reviews.text: The range was good. I walk up in the mountains surrounding our town and it easily worked at 6 miles away, that is even without line-of-sight.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Richards

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable short range communication.
customer_reviews.text: We use two way radios for quick communication between cars when traveling. And in areas without cell phone service. 30 mile range is not realistic but a couple of miles is reasonable - depending on terrain. These radios are much better than others I’ve tried. I have not tested the waterproofing.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha99

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement for our old radios.
customer_reviews.text: We used handsets like this for our son for years. As long as he would answer, and stay in contact, he had quit a bit of freedom to roam safely, as boys over the years have always been want to do. We have found them quite practical,at this time in our lives. They are handy at thrift stores the size of Walmarts, K-marts, grocery stores, the mall, etc. while in wheelchairs and wanting to shop independently with differantly interests, birthdays, and Christmas. Also, if one gets to tired and needs to go home or eat the make finding each other a breeze. Also, easy to hollar, if we needed each other, in this ruff day and age.
customer_reviews.author: Noah TW Givens

customer_reviews.title: If the product you receive is new...it works great.
customer_reviews.text: When opening the box of the first set something wasn't right. Turned out the radios were not new. One of the radios was an older model and didnt work. Amazons awesome return service made the return easy. Two days later had a new set. After opening this box it was even more obvious that the first set were not new. The second set works awesome. Clear audio. Battery life is great on low power but much less on high power. Even on low power the range is a couple of miles.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great semi rugged waterproof comm for outdoos
customer_reviews.text: These will reach a few miles with full quietig even in a dense neighborhood with many trees and 2 story houses. They do leave a lot to be desired as far as battery life. Also, there is no auto shuttoff, if you leave them off, they will die even if the squelch stays on/closed.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J.

customer_reviews.title: Ability to monitor two channels at once is this model's standout feature
customer_reviews.text: What makes this particular pair of FRS radios stand out for us is its ability to closely monitor two channels while ignoring all other channels. That allows us to have a private channel for our own communication, while still also listening for any group communications by the charity with which we serve in a place where our cell phones don't work. I also like that these radios use 4 AA batteries, rather than the 3 of our other pair of Motorola FRS radios, and hope that translates into a longer time between needing a recharge. (Overall size is about the same.)
customer_reviews.author: Man in the MiddleTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Not Great Range, Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for longer range out of these, but at best you can get 1 mile if completely clear. If not clear at best 1/4 mile. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Mills

customer_reviews.title: Barely 500 feet not 30 miles as claimed
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately bought few sets. Not worth headache of repacking and returning them. This is nothing more than a toy. Barely went 5 houses down and claims to reach 30 miles!!! Hell of a difference from 500 feet to 30 miles. Great toy but nothing more.
customer_reviews.author: Jab

product_meta.title: Midland 50 Channel Waterproof GMRS Two-Way Radio - Long Range Walkie Talkie with 142 Privacy Codes, SOS Siren, and NOAA Weather Alerts and Weather Scan (Black/Silver, Pair Pack)
feature_bullets: 2-WAY RADIOS - These walkie-talkies feature 50 GMRS (General Mobile Radio Service) channels, along with channel scan to check for activity. The JIS4 Waterproof Protection prevents splashing water from having any harmful effect on it (splash resistant).
36-MILE RANGE - Longer range communication in open areas with little or no obstruction. Easy Voice and Sound Activation Transmission (eVOX) with 9 sensitivity levels for hands-free operation.
142 CTCSS/DCS PRIVACY CODES - The privacy codes give you up to 3,124 channel options to block other conversations.

NOAA WEATHER SCAN + ALERT - NOAA Weather Scan will automatically scan through 10 available weather (WX) band channels and locks onto the strongest weather channel to alert you of severe weather updates. NOAA Weather Alert will sound an alarm indicating that there is a risk of severe weather in your area.
INCLUDED IN THE BOX: Radios (x2), rechargeable battery packs (x2), boom mic headsets (x2), belt clips (x2), 120V dual desktop charger, AC adapter, DC adapter, and an owner’s manual.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars4,476 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Additional Features: We stand by our products and service 100%.
specifications.Included Components: Rechargeable battery packs included or may be used with 4 AA batteries per radio
